meanings.definition: a state, period, or place of isolation in which people or animals that have arrived from elsewhere or been exposed to infectious or contagious disease are placed.
meanings.sent1: During the outbreak, the government set up quarantines to keep sick individuals separate.
meanings.sent2: The quarantines at the border helped prevent the spread of the virus.
meanings.sent3: The quarantines were like invisible shields protecting the healthy population.
meanings.sent4: In times of danger, quarantines act as safety nets for the community.
meanings.sent5: The image of the quarantines stayed etched in their minds as a symbol of safety.

meanings.definition: impose isolation on (a person, animal, or place).
meanings.sent1: Authorities may need to quarantines those who have been in close contact with infected individuals.
meanings.sent2: The decision to quarantines the entire building was made to prevent further spread.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to quarantines itself in the corner of the room after the vet visit.
meanings.sent4: She felt like her emotions were quarantined, unable to escape the walls she built.
meanings.sent5: The storm quarantined the town, cutting off all access to the outside world.
